Aitor Gual Gozalbo

  • Endereço para acessar este CV: http://lattes.cnpq.br/8885448292937700
  • Última atualização do currículo em 06/08/2014

Aitor Gual Gozalbo completed his undergraduate studies in Chemistry at the Universitat Jaume I of Castellón in 2004. He was awarded his PhD from the Universitat Rovira i Virgili of Tarragona in 2009 under the guidance of Prof. C. Claver and Prof. S. Castillón for his work on the synthesis of new chiral diphosphite ligands and their application in asymmetric catalysis. After that, he became a postdoctoral fellow at the Centre Tecnológic de la Química de Catalunya (CTQC) in Tarragona, where his work focussed on the production of energy sources using metal nanoparticles. Between January 2012 and July 2014, he was working as postdoctoral fellow at the Laboratory of Molecular Catalysis (LAMOCA) in Porto Alegre. His research interests deal with the synthesis and development of novel metal nanoparticles stabilised by supported ionic liquids and their application in catalysis. (Texto informado pelo autor)

Outras informações relevantes

 
EXPERTISE:
Organic synthesis and organometallic chemistry: 
  Design and synthesis of P-donor ligands (and their supported counterparts). 
  Design and synthesis of ionic liquids (and their supported counterparts).
  Synthesis and characterization of organometallic complexes (Pd, Rh, Ir, Ru, Co and Fe). 
  Synthesis and characterization of metal nanoparticles (Pd, Rh, Ir, Ru, Co and Fe).
Catalytic applications (homogeneous and heterogeneous): 
  Fischer-Tropsch, hydroformylation, alcoxycarbonylation, hydrogenation and C-C bond forming reactions. 
  Mechanistic studies of catalytic cycles.

TECHNICAL SKILLS:
  Start-up of projects: set-up of reaction systems and analytical methods. 
  Actively involved in the start-up process of the new Chemical Technology Center of Catalonia (CTQC) laboratories.
  Supervision of undergraduate students on independent projects that led to publishable results.
  Standard (vacuum line and Schlenk tube) and glove box techniques for handling air-sensitive materials.
  Experience in high-pressure experiments. 
  Experience in multinuclear NMR (1D and 2D techniques) on Bruker and Varian instruments. 
  Skilled in routine use of HPLC, GC, GC-MS, IR, UV-VIS, AA spectroscopy, Elemental Analysis (EA), Induced Coupled Plasma (ICP), gas physisorption (N2) and chemisorption (CO and H2) analyses, Scanning Electron Microscopy (SEM), Transmission Electron Microscopy (TEM and S-TEM), X-ray Photoelectron Spectroscopy (XPS) and X-Ray Diffraction (XRD).

COMPUTER SKILLS: 
  Knowledge of Windows, Mac and Linux environments. 
  Chemistry software: ChemBioOffice2013, NMR (MestRe-C, gNMR), XPS (CasaXPS) and Reference Manager (Endnote and Mendeley).
